page.title: 06Harpsichords and Clavichords
page.content: There is in Bradbourne Road a Harpsichord and Clavichord workshop. Two men work there making and repairing these old-fashioned keyboard instruments. The showroom is upstairs where there is one spinet and a few Harpichords. One of the men has been working there for seven years. The spinet sounds like a lute. It is about the size of a small piano but smaller than a Harpsichord. The Harpsichords are hand-painted by professionals and decorated mostly with flowers. The phrase {"Jack in the Box"} comes from the Harpsichord. The Jack is the piece of wood that is shaped to pluck the strings by bobbing up and down. The box is the casing of the strings. Harpsichords cost between 1900 and 6000 pounds.
